name: Crowne Plaza Hamburg - City Alster

reviews.text: I have booked from theire website, and everything was ready when I arrived at the hotel. Room was nice, warm and clean. A new thing showed up, a parfume (i would call it) giving a good nights sleep was next to my bed. This was tried out with a good result.
reviews.title: Ready and prepaired

reviews.text: Strange location, not great for exploring the city centre, but clean and comfortable and a close cab ride to/from the airport. Poor welcome as a Priority Club member. No free wifi. The breakfast selection was first class with great continental produce, very good quality. Food and service in the bar was below average but there was little selection near-by. Overall though I'd be happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Average city hotel

reviews.text: Room was very nice, breakfast excellent, location was a bit far off, but we don't mind the walking. Anyway, taxis are not very expensive (around 10 euros from hotel to city centre). Staff at the reception was very friendly and helpful. We've spent New Year's Eve there and they've organized a lovely meal and music for the event. Overall a very pleasant experience. I would definitely go back and/or recommend it.
reviews.title: pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: Stayed recently at the CP Hamburg Alster Friday through Sunday. The hotel is easily reached by the number 6 bus which stops outside the Hauptbanhof on kirchenalleestrasse. During my trip i lost a credit card and the reception staff allowed me to use the house phone to cnx my card with my provider (it appears that there is no reverse charge calling available in Germany?) However this kind act was much appreciated and i found all the CP staff very welcoming and helpful. One small criticism (which is an ongoing bug bear of mine) is that the hotel towels were quite worn and could have done with being replaced!!!!!! I know that its not always possible to offer new/plump towels but CP management should keep an eye on the towel quality as (most of us?) expect a plump luxurious towel to bathe and wash with!!!!!
reviews.title: good weekend away destination

reviews.text: we spend weekend at Hamburg, purpose was to visit Christmas market, this time me and my wife's parents and friend.
reviews.title: Christmas market trip to Hamburg

reviews.text: I have stayed here several times and am intimately familiar with Hamburg and the hotel choices. The rooms here are run down and in need of renovation which is what they will be getting apparently in 2013. In the meantime they are renovating the common areas which doesn't leave you with a clean smoke free room. Of the 2 rooms I booked one was not available despite pre-paying and the other stank of smoke.
reviews.title: Save your money till after the renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet and parking costs drive up the price of staying here by another $35. Needless to say I shan't be staying here again in a hurry. Shame really as it used to be quite OK
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quite area well connected to the center of the city. Bus and metro are really very close to the hotel. We had some nice days during our staying in Hamburg so we also walked to the city. It is maybe a 20 minutes walk but it's very relaxing.
reviews.title: Quiet location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our standard room was on the 3rd floor and it was spotless and looked like new. I peeked in one of the Club Room and they are bigger, so maybe you should ask for one of those if you travel with a lot of things and big luggage, otherwise standard rooms work just fine.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: Breakfast was super! Whether you like continental or not, you will find a lot of things to eat. There are cakes, muffins, jars of delicious marmalade but also eggs, fish, bacon, beans, lyoner, mushrooms and tons of fruit! It costs 20 euro per person, quite expensive but quality was good.
reviews.title: Better Than Adequate

reviews.text: The hotel was decent enough with pretty nice rooms. It is located about a 15-20 minute walk from the train station or 5 minute bus ride. There are no restaurants/stores in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.
reviews.title: Ok but expensive internet

reviews.text: My main gripe was that internet was ridicously expensive: €5 per hour or €22 for 24 hours.
reviews.title: Highly recomendable

reviews.text: A nice touch was that I got a really nice razor when I had forgotten mine at home.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: Very good service, both during booking and durring the stay. Great bathroom, delicious breakfast, great bed, lovely staff. This is a hotel I would like to come back to ;o)
reviews.title: Cracking Hotel

reviews.text: Just have to say, that the price for internet/wifi, is to high :o(
reviews.title: Unacceptable low standard & overpriced.

reviews.text: The E-Class hotel which is meant for business purpose.
reviews.title: Executive class hotel

reviews.text: Great environment,
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a stench

reviews.text: spacious rooms and services are good.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel

reviews.text: Friendly staff.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: I really enjoyed staying at Crowne Plaza after I got used to the smell in the hallway. Breakfast is nice with a friendly lady frying an omelette for you but the service can be at their limit at times
reviews.title: Good business hotel close to Alster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this hotel to be very nice. We just stayed here for 5 nights. Rooms and bathroom were a good size for a european hotel. Coffee service in the room was a plus because the breakfast buffet was 20 euro per person!! Lots of places to grab a pastry and coffee nearby. The front desk staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. We came back one day to find our room not cleaned. One call to the front desk and someone was cleaning our room and we were having a drink in the bar at management's expense. While not located in the heart of the city, the hotel is right by the lake and there is a bus stop right across the street that has connections to the train station and to the center of town. Charges to park a car here are steep but they are at most of the hotels in Hamburg. Get the Hamburg card - great value. Would definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.text: Stayed second time at the Crowne Plaza since it has good location, clean and quiet rooms and reasonable rates if booked by internet.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but lack of service, expensive garage

reviews.text: During last stay my room was not cleaned for 1 night. The german staff provides excellent service bue some of the othe employees (Chinese, Indian) have service gaps.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good value

likes.liked: — Hotel was really great and I had a great holiday here.

reviews.text: The garage is horribly expensive (21,50 € per night) and it is not accessible with bulky luggage. The guests have to walk down a stair, then an underground corridor and then again up on stairs (no elevator) to the garage. There is not access on the ground level - this is completely stupid. After I complained I got reimboursed the cost for the garage but this does not solve the problem.
reviews.title: German hospitality

likes.disliked: — Only one quite small window in the room

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel with one of the greatest breakfast buffets I have ever seen. Even sparkling wine is server on the buffet, and almost anything you can imagine. Really worth the money.
reviews.title: Good Position and Good Value
Loved the Crowne Plaza, Hamburg
reviews.text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza and took a taxi from the station to the hotel. It is easily walkable in about 10 mins or so, but with cases we chose a taxi.

The hotel is in a lovely quiet location, with nearby restaurants and bars. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and we were upgraded to a club room upon arrival which was perfect, (with a separate lounge area and toilet). The beds and bed linen were so comfy and the bathroom very modern. A very spacious room all in all.
reviews.title: clean and great service, tiny bathroom

likes.disliked: — the rubbery pancakes and the not so warm swimmingpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool with whirlpool tub was very welcoming at the end of the day followed by the sauna and steam room.
reviews.title: A quiet hotel in a nice area

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was extensive and catered for the masses (and there were masses of people piling their plates high)! The hot food wasnt very hot though and it was a tad expensive at €21 so we only had it the one night.
reviews.title: Nice stay in a quiet neighborhood

reviews.text: A very good hotel to stay in away from the hustle and bustle but still you can take a lovely short 15 minute walk to the centre along the scenic Alster Lake and past the famous Atlantic Hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel close to city center

likes.liked: — room and close to city center

aka: Crowne Plaza Hamburg - City Alster Hotel
description: Celebrate business success at the Crowne Plaza Hamburg-City Alster hotel, near Lake Aussenalster and 10 minutes' walk from the city centre.You'll be energised by the bright, white and soaring atrium of Crowne Plaza Hamburg-City Alster's Lobby, located on Graumannsweg in central Hamburg. Our friendly Front Desk staff will direct you to your modern room, or you can sit back with a coffee in our trendy King George Bar.It's 20 minutes' drive from Hamburg Airport to Crowne Plaza Hamburg-City Alster.
